config.name: description
config.values: Neutron events were stored in NeXus files via the ESS DAQ (European Spallation Source Data AcQuisition) system

@article{Mukai_2018,
doi = {10.1088/1748-0221/13/10/T10001},
url = {https://dx.doi.org/10.1088/1748-0221/13/10/T10001},
year = {2018},
month = {oct},
publisher = {},

number = {10},
pages = {T10001},
author = {A.H.C. Mukai and M.J. Clarke and M.J. Christensen and J.M.C. Nilsson and M.G. Shetty and M. Brambilla and D. Werder and M. Könnecke and J. Harper and M.D. Jones and F.A. Akeroyd and C. Reis and G. Kourousias and T.S. Richter},
title = {Architecture of the data aggregation and streaming system for the European Spallation Source neutron instrument suite},
journal = {Journal of Instrumentation},
abstract = {The European Spallation Source (ESS) will provide long   neutron pulses for experiments on a suite of different   instruments. Most of these will perform neutron data acquisition in   event mode, i.e. each detected neutron will be characterised by one   absolute timestamp and pixel identifier pair. Slow controls metadata   from EPICS, such as sample environment measurements and motor   positions, will also be timestamped at their source, so that all   data and metadata are streamed as a list of events instead of   histograms. A flexible data aggregation and streaming system is   being developed combining both open source third-party software and   in-house development. This is to be used at ESS and other neutron   scattering facilities like ISIS and SINQ, replacing legacy solutions   by a shared software collection maintained by a cross-facility   effort. The architecture of the Apache Kafka-based system, its   metadata forwarding and NeXus file writing components are presented,   along with test results demonstrating their integration and the   scalability in terms of performance.}
}

%0 Journal Article
%T Architecture of the data aggregation and streaming system for the European Spallation Source neutron instrument suite
%A Mukai, A. H. C.
%A Clarke, M. J.
%A Christensen, M. J.
%A Nilsson, J. M. C.
%A Shetty, M. G.
%A Brambilla, M.
%A Werder, D.
%A Könnecke, M.
%A Harper, J.
%A Jones, M. D.
%A Akeroyd, F. A.
%A Reis, C.
%A Kourousias, G.
%A Richter, T. S.
%J Journal of Instrumentation
%D 2018
%8 oct
%V 13
%N 10
%F Mukai_2018
%X The European Spallation Source (ESS) will provide long neutron pulses for experiments on a suite of different instruments. Most of these will perform neutron data acquisition in event mode, i.e. each detected neutron will be characterised by one absolute timestamp and pixel identifier pair. Slow controls metadata from EPICS, such as sample environment measurements and motor positions, will also be timestamped at their source, so that all data and metadata are streamed as a list of events instead of histograms. A flexible data aggregation and streaming system is being developed combining both open source third-party software and in-house development. This is to be used at ESS and other neutron scattering facilities like ISIS and SINQ, replacing legacy solutions by a shared software collection maintained by a cross-facility effort. The architecture of the Apache Kafka-based system, its metadata forwarding and NeXus file writing components are presented, along with test results demonstrating their integration and the scalability in terms of performance.
%U https://dx.doi.org/10.1088/1748-0221/13/10/T10001
%U http://dx.doi.org/10.1088/1748-0221/13/10/T10001
%P 10001
